ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] How to setup crawl to pull just images down from outside website
ygData.msgSnippet: The default crawl settings will more-or-less do this. When you provide a seed, it will only crawl material on that site, and material transcluded from that

Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] How to setup crawl to pull just images down
 from outside website
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=137285340; y=K-phqAhatWo898ooy2I002Jz52kMANwqXMMTQKmvPHNN
X-Yahoo-Profile: gojomo

The default crawl settings will more-or-less do this. When you 
provide a seed, it will only crawl material on that site, and 
material 'transcluded' from that site such as inline images, frame 
source, javascript source, and CSS source. It will not follow 
offsite links in A/@HREF attributes.

How is the default insufficient for your needs?

- Gordon @ IA

mjjjhjemj wrote:
> I am performing a crawl of a website that reference images from other
> domains. I have setup my crawl to be very restrictive so that it stays
> only on the paths I wish, but I do need it to visit other domains to
> just pull down images.
> 
> Basically I need to make sure the crawl remains very restrictive for
> gathering links to pursue, but open to pulling down images from those
> links that pass even if they are on other domains.
> 
> How would I suggest doing this?
> 
> Thanks,
> Mike
